vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πρωτοτόκ-ος
(paroxytone), Doric dialect πρᾱτοτόκος, ον, bearing or having borne her first-born, μήτηρ π., of a heifer, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; ὗς, ταὧς, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of women, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II proparoxytone πρωτότοκος, ον, passive,first-born, [LXX+NT+4th c.AD+]; π. ἐγὼ ἢ σύ [LXX]
__II.2 metaphorically, π. πάσης κτίσεως [NT]; of Homer, opposed to Nicander, [Refs]
vocabInfos.shortDef: firstborn (human or animal). In biblical culture, the firstborn had higher status and received a greater share of the inheritance. Jesus Christ, as the firstborn of God, is of supreme status and inherits all things
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
firstborn (human or animal). In biblical culture, the firstborn had higher status and received a greater share of the inheritance. Jesus Christ, as the firstborn of God, is of supreme status and inherits all things
first-born, Lk. 2:7; Heb. 11:28; in NT prior in generation, Col. 1:15; a firstborn head of a spiritual family, Rom. 8:29; Heb. 1:6; firstborn, as possessed of the peculiar privilege of spiritual generation, Heb. 12:23
vocabInfos._es_Definition: primogénito, primero;  Hijo primogénito (de Cristo) ; anterior a todo lo creado o superior a toda la creación (COL.1:15)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 頭胎出生的
1a) 字意: 先出生的
1b) 喻意, 指頭生的特別地位
1b1) 基督
1b2) 一般人 (來 12:23)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 头胎出生的
1a) 字意: 先出生的
1b) 喻意, 指头生的特别地位
1b1) 基督
1b2) 一般人 (来 12:23)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: sinh ra trước nhất ; trưởng tử. πρῶτος (G4413) + τίκτω (G5088)
